headline: Cigna (CI): Evaluating Company Valuation Following Multi-Billion Dollar Senior Notes Issuance
summary: If you own shares in Cigna Group (CI), you probably took notice of the company’s just-completed, multi-tranche senior notes issuance. With new debt totaling several billion dollars and maturities that stretch from 2030 all the way to 2056, this is not your average corporate debt raise. Moves like this can ripple across a company’s financial profile and potentially reshape liquidity and future flexibility. These developments rarely fly under the radar for investors with an eye on valuation or...
